content: I do NOT mean occasionally glancing at what they are doing as you walk by, or just keeping the computer in a public location in the house. I mean monitor what sites they go to, who they chat with, and what they chat about, who is on their my space/facebook accounts, whose accounts they go to..... FULL BLOWN MONITORING.... I do. I do not hide it from my kids. They know that I get an email summary every day that tells me where they have been and what they have looked at. If they go to a site that is questionable, I get an immediate email. If they use any words that could be questionable..... I get an immediate email. If they type any part of their name, address, phone number, etc, I get an email. Should they get froggy and decide that they are "smarter" than dad and try to backdoor my security, I get.... you got it, an immediate email. If any of my kids wants a myspace account, facebook, etc, I have to have the password. If I try to log into their account, and the password is different than what they gave me, the child will lose the privilege of having it. The same with any gmail accounts or chat rooms of any type. Apologies to all reading, and if you do not fall into this category, I'm not talking about you, BUT, the internet is full of FREAKS and PREDATORS. Yes.... I unapologetically monitor my kids, with their full knowledge. I don't sneak around and do it, I do it out in the open. What say you? Question: Do you monitor your kids activities on the internet? Choices: Nope, not at all. Yes, a little. Yes, I keep a pretty good eye on them. I DOG THEIR EVERY MOVE!!!   "The things that will destroy America are prosperity at any price, peace at any price, safety first instead of duty first, the love of soft living and the get rich quick theory of life." ~~~Theodore Roosevelt~~~

content: When I had a LANtastic Internet system in the house I also had a "verbose" command that sent an assigned users keystrokes to a printer (old school). This was back in the days on the BBS and I didn't take any chances. I read everything they wrote in response to any question posed. Later I just sent it into a print file and added incoming messages to the procedures. Nowadays they have really good software to meet the demands of a good spy. Watch what your kids are doing on the internet and make sure you talk to them about questionable sites. Quantum materiae materietur marmota monax si marmota monax materiam possit materiari?

If you search for monitoring software, internet monitoring, parental control software, etc, you can find both free software, which can be quite good, or paid for software, usually better, or some with a monthly fee. The one I use is available free, and for a fee you get much better monitoring. It's out there... look at the features and decide how much you need. title: How many of you actively monitor your childrens internet activities?

content: A few of my friends think I am TOO cautious ... but as one of your choices is: "I DOG THEIR EVERY MOVE"! I routinely log into their MySpace, IM, ICQ and email accounts. I have written in patches to their puters that will not allow them to delete history. "I" do it after I first view it w/ a password. And the best patch I think I ever installed on their sets was a remote patch that will allow me to log in remotely even though we're almost 5K miles apart from each other ... and they don't even know when I do it. It's flippin great and I wish I could see their faces when they start getting a tad over zealous w/ their language and I start typing in their chat boxes w/ their friends, and immediately they know they're BUSTED! The phone will soon ring and the guilty child had better answer and explain. Now don't get me wrong everyone. I DON'T just hang out on the internet hoping my kids will screw up. I don't even log in daily anymore. They now know the dangers out there and I feel better knowing that they know I have the capability to check in on their activities. Bottom line is, I firmly believe EVERY parent should have at a minimum a keystroke logger type program loaded on their childrens' computer. Preditors are everywhere and parents need to keep a watchfull eye on their kids internet activities as they would if they were simply walking around the mall. Only real differance is you can't tell when a bad guy is stalking your child on the internet as you may SEE it happening in the mall or some other public area.
